get.description: Lists all existing interactions. Results can be filtered by encounter status and patient identifier.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Field used to sort interactions. Allowed values: [startedAt, endedAt, updatedAt, lastUpdated]. Default is startedAt.

schema.description: Field used to sort interactions. Allowed values: [startedAt, endedAt, updatedAt, lastUpdated]. Default is startedAt.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Sorting order. Allowed values: [asc, desc]. Default is desc.

schema.description: Sorting order. Allowed values: [asc, desc]. Default is desc.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of interactions to return per page. Must be greater than 0. Default is 10.

schema.description: Number of interactions to return per page. Must be greater than 0. Default is 10.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve. Starts at 1. For example, index=2 with pageSize=10 will return interactions 11–20. Must be greater than 0. Default is 1.

schema.description: Page number to retrieve. Starts at 1. For example, index=2 with pageSize=10 will return interactions 11–20. Must be greater than 0. Default is 1.

parameters.name: encounterStatus
parameters.description: The status of the encounter. To filter on multiple statuses, pass the same parameter again.

schema.description: The status of the encounter. To filter on multiple statuses, pass the same parameter again.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the patient. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: A unique identifier for the patient. Must be a valid UUID.

201.description: Returns the newly created interaction with its assigned ID and WebSocket URL for real-time data streaming.

200.description: Returns the requested interaction with all associated details.

get.description: Retrieves a previously recorded interaction by its unique identifier (interaction ID).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction to retrieve. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the interaction to retrieve. Must be a valid UUID.

200.description: A request body containing the fields to update within the interaction.

patch.description: Modifies an existing interaction by updating specific fields without overwriting the entire record.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction to update. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the interaction to update. Must be a valid UUID.

204.description: The interaction was successfully deleted. No response body is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction to delete. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the interaction to delete. Must be a valid UUID.

200.description: Returns a list of recording IDs for the interaction.

get.description: Retrieve a list of recordings for a given interaction.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which recordings should be retrieved. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which recordings should be retrieved. Must be a valid UUID.

201.description: Returns the recording ID in the response.

post.description: Upload a recording for a given interaction. There is a maximum limit of 60 minutes in length and 150MB in size for recordings.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which recording should be attributed. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which recording should be attributed. Must be a valid UUID.
Recording
schema.title: Recording

200.description: Binary content of the recording file.

get.description: Retrieve a specific recording for a given interaction.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which the recording should be retrieved. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which the recording should be retrieved. Must be a valid UUID.

parameters.name: recordingId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the recording to be retrieved. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the recording to be retrieved. Must be a valid UUID.

delete.description: Delete a specific recording for a given interaction.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which the recording should be deleted from. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which the recording should be deleted from. Must be a valid UUID.

parameters.name: recordingId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the recording to be deleted. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the recording to be deleted. Must be a valid UUID.

200.description: Returns a list of transcripts associated with the interaction.

get.description: Retrieves a list of transcripts for a given interaction.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which transcripts should be retrieved. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which transcripts should be retrieved. Must be a valid UUID.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Describes transcript attribute for sorting

schema.description: Describes transcript attribute for sorting

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Describes sorting direction

schema.description: Describes sorting direction

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of transcripts to return. For example, a pageSize of 10 will return a maximum of 10 interactions.

schema.description: The number of transcripts to return. For example, a pageSize of 10 will return a maximum of 10 interactions.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The number of transcripts to skip. For example, index=2 with pageSize=10 will skip the first 10 interactions and return 11-20.

schema.description: The number of transcripts to skip. For example, index=2 with pageSize=10 will skip the first 10 interactions and return 11-20.

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Display full transcripts in listing

schema.description: Display full transcripts in listing

201.description: Returns the generated transcript, including participant roles and timestamps for each utterance.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which the transcript is created. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the interaction for which the transcript is created. Must be a valid UUID.

patch.description: Updates an existing fact within a specific interaction. If the interaction `status = "in progress"`, the updated fact will be sent to the client via WebSocket. To discard a fact, simply set `discarded = true`.

200.description: Alignment results with percentage and optionally aligned segments.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was malformed or missing required parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized - Authentication failed or user is not authorized.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An error occurred on the server.

post.description: Compares two reference texts, a 'source' document and a 'target' document, and returns a percentage alignment, optionally including aligned segments.
This endpoint is used for binary classification tasks: comparing two resources, where a boolean output is expected.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The interaction ID representing the context for the request. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The interaction ID representing the context for the request. Must be a valid UUID.

200.description: SSE streaming response with results from multiple tools. The initial response includes a thread ID for continuing the conversation. (`text/event-stream`)

400.description: Bad Request - The request was malformed or missing required parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized - Authentication failed or user is not authorized.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An error occurred on the server.

post.description: Allows users to ask questions or make queries in the context of a specific interaction. This endpoint supports Server-Sent Events (SSE) for real-time updates and responses. The thread ID, which is returned with the initial query, allows users to ask follow-up questions or refine their queries. This endpoint is designed to facilitate dynamic and context-aware conversations, making it suitable for applications such as chatbots, virtual assistants, research tools and workflow augmentation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The interaction ID representing the context for the request. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The interaction ID representing the context for the request. Must be a valid UUID.

parameters.name: threadId
parameters.description: The thread ID representing the context for the request. Must be a valid UUID.

schema.description: The thread ID representing the context for the request. Must be a valid UUID.

200.description: Returns a summary and a list of relevant sources.

post.description: Access and unlock knowledge bases and guidelines tools queries, documents, or interactions. This endpoint is designed to facilitate the retrieval of relevant information from various sources, enabling users to access and utilize knowledge bases and guidelines effectively. The response includes a summary and a list of relevant sources, providing users with a comprehensive overview of the retrieved information.

200.description: Returns an array of suggested questions.

post.description: Provides a list of suggested questions based on a query and/or interaction context.

200.description: Returns an array of mentions found in the reference texts.

post.description: Finds mentions of defined content within a set of reference texts.

200.description: JSON representation of the API documentation

get.description: JSON representation of the API documentation.

subsetName.description: Category or subset of the additional code

isSelected.description: Indicates whether the code is selected

status.description: Indicates the current state of the encounter, crucial for understanding the progression and current state of care.

type.description: The specific type of encounter, providing context about the nature and setting of the patient interaction.

period.description: The time period during which the encounter takes place.

title.description: A readable name for the interaction

startedAt.description: The start date/time of the encounter. (UTC)

endedAt.description: The end date/time of the encounter. (UTC)

text.description: The text of the fact.

group.description: The group to which the fact belongs.

source.description: The source of the fact. 'USER' refers to facts provided by the user, while 'SYSTEM' refers to system-generated facts (e.g., EHR).

time.description: Time range in seconds for transcript type.

name.description: FHIR reference to Text representation of the full name.

birthDate.description: FHIR reference to patient birth date.

pronouns.description: FHIR reference to patient extension Individual Pronouns.

summary.description: For guidelines, a summary of the response.

favicon.description: The favicon URL of the source.

type.description: The type of the source (e.g., PDF, Web).

description.description: A brief description of the source.

response.description: General chat response in markdown format.
